column4: CAN sombody help me. I started up ubuntu today and everything is messed up. My default  theme disapeared and my fonts aer messed up. The font that is displaying is really blurry and hard to read!!!!
calm down please. go to system>Preferences>themes and choose clearlooks
what have you done so far? when have the problems begin?
any error messages? was it working before?
is my fonts folder surpose to be locked?
bash: cd: /home/alex/.fonts/: No such file or directory
the system wide fonts folder is locked to normal users so they do not mess up the system
bash: cd: /home/alex/.fonts/: No such file or directory <-- is that normal.
yes it is normal. i have one because i created it
i can not know for sure.look for errors in the logs (less /var/log/Xorg.0.log)
i do have these warnings too. that is not the problem
i am out of ideas now
add a grub entry for ubuntu to mandriva's menu.lst (or viceversa)
how would i do that? or should i just google it? heh
